tooltip: Use the email linked to your BikeFit account. We will send a one-time login code.
Use the 7-character code from your email. Enter letters and numbers exactly as shown.
Gebruik het e-mailadres van je BikeFit-account. We sturen een eenmalige inlogcode.
Gebruik de 7-tekens code uit je e-mail. Vul letters en cijfers exact in.
Total standing height used for frame-size and reach calculations.
Floor-to-crotch distance. This is the primary driver for saddle height.
Hip-bone to shoulder distance to improve cockpit reach accuracy.
Shoulder-to-wrist distance used with torso length for reach tuning.
Outer shoulder-bone width used to calculate suitable handlebar width.
Hip-joint to knee-center distance to improve setback confidence.
Use a recognizable name so you can pick this bike in future fit sessions.
Choose the category that best matches this bike's intended riding style.
Vertical distance from bottom bracket to head tube top-center.
Horizontal distance from bottom bracket to head tube top-center.
Seat tube angle helps align saddle setback with your frame geometry.
Head tube angle helps characterize handling and cockpit assumptions.
Manufacturer size label (for example 54, M, or 56cm).
Current saddle height used for recommended-vs-current comparison.
Horizontal saddle position behind bottom bracket.
Current stem length used to interpret cockpit reach.
Stem pitch affects handlebar height and perceived drop.
Center-to-center width used for control and comfort checks.
Current crank size compared against inseam-based recommendations.
Dynamic tooltip: Enter a numeric value [in unit]. Allowed range is min-max [unit]. This answer is used directly in fit calculations.
Provide concise details that help personalize your recommendation. Include symptoms, context, or preferences when relevant.
Report destination email. Use an address you can access now.
Add your name so support can address your message and follow-up clearly.
Use an email you can access now so we can respond to your request.
Describe your question and context so we can provide a useful response faster.
Vul je naam in zodat support je bericht duidelijk kan opvolgen.
Gebruik een e-mailadres dat je nu kunt openen voor onze reactie.
Beschrijf je vraag en context zodat we sneller gericht kunnen helpen.
Use floor-to-crotch inseam in centimeters (55-105). This value has the biggest impact on saddle-height output.
Bike category selects different fit multipliers and offsets, which changes the final recommendation.
Goal changes comfort/performance offsets. Aggressive goals usually increase saddle and cockpit demand.
Enter an integer from 1 to 5. Lower flexibility reduces aggressive fit assumptions.
Enter an integer from 1 to 5. Core stability affects how aggressive the recommended position can be.
Enter standing height in centimeters (130-210). Height helps determine your initial frame-size band.
Enter inseam in centimeters (55-105). Inseam refines frame-size and saddle-baseline estimates.
Category changes sizing logic (for example road/gravel numeric sizes vs MTB/city size bands).
Enter inseam in centimeters (55-105). This value selects your crank-length bracket.
Bike category applies small adjustments (for example MTB clearance preference) to baseline crank length.
